articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippine coast guard on Friday accused its Chinese counterpart of blocking efforts to evacuate a sick member of its armed forces in the South China Sea, calling its actions "barbaric and inhumane".
articles.title: Philippines accuses Chinese coast guard of 'barbaric' blocking of medical evacuation

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israel targeted a Gaza school on Thursday that it said contained an Hamas compound, killing fighters involved in the Oct. 7 attack that sparked the eight-month war, but Gaza media said the strike killed at least 27 people seeking shelter.
articles.title: Israel says jets strike school containing Hamas compound, Gaza media says 27 killed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he will "present the truth" about the war against Hamas in Gaza when he addresses the U.S. Congress on July 24 during a visit to Washington, Republican leaders said on Thursday.
articles.title: Israel's Netanyahu to address U.S. Congress on July 24

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden will meet Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskiy in Paris on Friday with a package of $225 million in weapons on the sidelines of D-Day anniversary events.
articles.title: Biden to meet Zelenskiy in France with $225 million in military aid

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Vladimir Soldatkin
articles.description: Cut off from the West, Russia is pitching its $2 trillion economy to giants like China and Saudi Arabia and longer-term prospects like Zimbabwe and Afghanistan at its premier investment forum in St Petersburg, which was founded by the tsars as a window to Europe.
articles.title: Amid war, Putin looks east from Russia's window to Europe

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: Russia and China, which hold veto powers in the U.N. Security Council, raised concerns on Thursday with a U.S. draft resolution that would back a proposal - outlined by President Joe Biden - for a ceasefire between Israel and Palestinian militants Hamas.
articles.title: Russia, China wrangle with US over UN resolution on Gaza ceasefire plan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Newly elected lawmakers of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's National Democratic Alliance (NDA) arrived in New Delhi on Friday for their first meeting at which he will be formally elected as their leader, ahead of presenting his claim to form a new coalition government.
articles.title: Modi set to be formally elected as alliance leader as India coalition talks progress

articles.author: Lucy Craymer
articles.description: Further landslides will likely plague the area where part of a mountain collapsed onto a remote village in Papua New Guinea two weeks ago, New Zealand geological experts warned on Friday, as authorities ended search and rescue efforts.
articles.title: Papua New Guinea ends landslide rescue efforts amid fears of another

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Australia's ambassador to the United States, Kevin Rudd, cautioned in a speech that the global consequences of a war over Taiwan would be as great as the impact of the Second World War, making the world "a radically different place".
articles.title: War over Taiwan would change world, says Australia ambassador to US Kevin Rudd

articles.author: Jack Queen, Tom Hals
articles.description: Hunter Biden's sister-in-law testified on Thursday that she took and threw away his gun out of fear of his spiraling addiction, potentially bolstering prosecutors' case that President Joe Biden's son broke a law barring illegal drug users from owning firearms.
articles.title: Hunter Biden's sister-in-law describes finding crack, gun in his truck
